content.question: Which of the following could be a slope field for the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, y squared, minus x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>âˆ’</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 3 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The slopes of the line segments are positive with line segments near the origin appearing close to horizontal. In Quadrant 1, the slopes of the line segments are increasing as x increases and y increases. In Quadrant 2, the slopes of the line segments are increasing as x decreases and y increases. In Quadrant 3, the slopes of the line segments are increasing as x decreases and y decreases. In Quadrant 4, the slopes of the line segments are increasing as x increases and y decreases.

The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 3 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. In Quadrant 1, there are some horizontal line segments that form a diagonal. Above the horizontal line segments, the slopes are positive. Below the horizontal line segments, the slopes are negative. In this quadrant, the slopes are decreasing as x increases, and increasing as y increases. In Quadrant 2, there are some horizontal line segments that form a diagonal. Above the horizontal line segments, the slopes are positive. Below the horizontal line segments, the slopes are negative. In this quadrant, the slopes are decreasing as x decreases, and increasing as y increases. In Quadrant 3, there are some horizontal line segments that form a diagonal. Above the horizontal line segments, the slopes are negative. Below the horizontal line segments, the slopes are positive. In this quadrant, the slopes are decreasing as x decreases, and increasing as y decreases. In Quadrant 4, there are some horizontal line segments that form a diagonal. Above the horizontal line segments, the slopes are negative. Below the horizontal line segments, the slopes are positive. In this quadrant, the slopes are decreasing as x increases, and increasing as y decreases.

The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 3 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. In Quadrant 1, there are some horizontal line segments that form the shape of a portion of a parabola. Above the horizontal line segments, the slopes are positive. Below the horizontal line segments, the slopes are negative. In this quadrant, the slopes are decreasing as x increases, and increasing as y increases. In Quadrant 2, the slopes of the line segments are positive, increasing as x decreases, and increasing as y increases. In Quadrant 3, the slopes of the line segments are positive, increasing as x decreases, and increasing as y decreases. In Quadrant 4, there are some horizontal line segments that form the shape of a portion of a parabola. Above the horizontal line segments, the slopes are negative. Below the horizontal line segments, the slopes are positive. In this quadrant, the slopes are decreasing as x increases, and increasing as y decreases.

The figure presents a slope field in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 3 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. In Quadrant 1, there are some horizontal line segments that form a diagonal. Above the horizontal line segments, the slopes are positive. Below the horizontal line segments, the slopes are negative. In this quadrant, the slopes are decreasing as x increases, and increasing as y increases. In Quadrant 2, the slopes of the line segments are positive, increasing as x decreases, and increasing as y increases. In Quadrant 3, there are some horizontal line segments that form a diagonal. Above the horizontal line segments, the slopes are positive. Below the horizontal line segments, the slopes are negative. In this quadrant, the slopes are increasing as x decreases, and decreasing as y decreases. In Quadrant 4, the slopes of the line segments are negative, decreasing as x increases, and decreasing as y decreases.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
